metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3569 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ssl23_get_client_hello function in s23_srvr.c in OpenSSL 0.9.8zc, 1.0.0o, and 1.0.1j does not properly handle attempts to use unsupported protocols, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via an unexpected handshake, as demonstrated by an SSLv3 handshake to a no-ssl3 application with certain error handling.  NOTE: this issue became relevant after the CVE-2014-3568 fix.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu10
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu10
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Ubuntu packages aren't compiled with no-ssl3, so aren't actually vulnerable to this issue.

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu10').
